How to Install powermanagement-interface on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • powermanagement-interface

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install powermanagement-interface on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing powermanagement-interface on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall powermanagement-interface in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install powermanagement-interface, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install powermanagement-interface Using apt

To install powermanagement-interface in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install powermanagement-interface using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install powermanagement-interface

The installation of powermanagement-interface might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install powermanagement-interface Using apt-get

To install powermanagement-interface using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install powermanagement-interface.

sudo apt-get -y install powermanagement-interface

Install powermanagement-interface Using Synaptic

To install powermanagement-interface using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install powermanagement-interface on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for powermanagement-interface. This will display the powermanagement-interface package in the package window, now to install powermanagement-interface, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the powermanagement-interface package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of powermanagement-interface.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install powermanagement-interface Using aptitude

To install powermanagement-interface on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of powermanagement-interface.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install powermanagement-interface using the command aptitude install powermanagement-interface.

sudo aptitude -y install powermanagement-interface

How to Upgrade powermanagement-interface on debian

If you want to upgrade the powermanagement-interface package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade powermanagement-interface using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade powermanagement-interface to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade powermanagement-interface.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade powermanagement-interface sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade powermanagement-interface

Upgrade powermanagement-interface using Aptitude

To upgrade powermanagement-interface using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade powermanagement-interface.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade powermanagement-interface

Upgrade powermanagement-interface using Synaptic

To upgrade powermanagement-interface using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for powermanagement-interface, now right-click powermanagement-interface, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade powermanagement-interface just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall powermanagement-interface on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall powermanagement-interface from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just powermanagement-interface, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove powermanagement-interface

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of powermanagement-interface

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of powermanagement-interface you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge powermanagement-interface

Remove powermanagement-interface using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall powermanagement-interface using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for powermanagement-interface, right-click the powermanagement-interface package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall powermanagement-interface click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install powermanagement-interface on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade powermanagement-interface using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of powermanagement-interface then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
